comments.text: Let me cross on foot Kurdistan to Turkey.  Iraqi/Kurdistan officers stopped a random car for me to get in to go over bridge (walking forbidden), told them taxi is too expensive.
Good spot to get towards Erbil

Very good stop.
First car stopped
Perfect spot to get to Duhol

All along the route from dujok to Amedi, to Soran sulaminyeh akra and back cars will stop in minutes. Even from the middle of villages. People are extremely kind and will invite you to stay and be hosted, for meals and tea. Kurdistan is the best

Asked the checkpoint before dujayl to get me a ride. They were super friendly and in minutes got a ride. 
Did check passport and pat me down
Many locals hitchhiking, some waiting time is needed
A taxi to the edge of town shouldn't cost more than 3k
As usual: just go to the edge of town and start hitchhiking. From the city center it's nearly an hour walk though. Direct lift all the way to Amedi within 15 minutes.

Checkpoint would not let me walk out of Samarra. 
All the officers that saw me walking in town asked where I was headed and redirected me to the mosque. 

Had a local friend talk to the checkpoint... he explained I was hitchhiking and then they helped stop a car to get me out!
Cars are going high speed, some taxis waiting on side. Trucks going to zakho so they will stop. Just wave and point.
Lots of fast traffic but still in the city. Got a ride in 15 mins to the outside of town. Easy to get a ride from there then. Can may 3usd for a taxi out the city instead

Direction Barzan and Akre (beautiful old town btw!) there's not much traffic, but as this is Kurdistan and people are incredibly friendly the first car will stop for you. The drive from here to Akre is immensly beautiful and a small hitchhiking adventure.
Somewhere here is cheaper shared taxis to duhok. 5$ ( 2025) instead of main garage. Get a bus from city center towards telskuf and get off at duhok garage. (Just taxis on side of road) .
Checkpoint was extremely rude and unhelpful. Refused to help stop a car. Told the current driver to drop me at the bus station.
